Label: Blinded participant ID
Sample code
Values: West Jordan Middle School = wjms, Boys and Girls club = bgc

Label: Interview: Initals of the interviewer who conducted the stress interview
Interview: Location of the interview
WJMS: Unique classroom code, combination of class period, teacher, and year
Sex assigned at birth
Values: Male = 1, Female = 2

Label: Self-reported racial identity
Questionnaire: Whether or not participant is of hispanic descent
Values: Yes, I am Hispanic / Latino. = 1, No, I am not Hispanic / Latino. = 2

Label: Interview: participant's age
Whether or not the participant has a sibling in this sample, 1 = yes, 0 = no
WJMS and BGC sibling codes combined into one variable, codes ending with '000' indicate no sibling
Interview: Was the participant able to read information at the end of the Assent document?
Interview: Interview rating of participant impairment that might have interferred with the assessment
Questionnaire: Attention Check, Sum of all missed attention items (max 4); higher scores reflect the number of attention items each participant failed
Questionnaire: Total number of all high or all low responses across scales with reverse coded items
School records: Special education classification for students who spend between 60 - 180 minutes per day receiving SpEd services or are  enrolled in SpEd classes
Exclusion Variable: Coder rated binary variable indicating extreme disruptions using RA notes, 0 = normal or low distraction level, 1 = possible distractions, 2 = extreme distraction
School records: Special education classification. Scored as 1 if classified as special ed at any point in the current school year
Values: Not Special Ed. = 0, Special Ed = 1

Label: Interviewer rating: how noisy was the testing environment during the cognitive tasks?
Values: Not at all = 1, 2 = 2, 3 = 3, Moderately = 4, 5 = 5, 6 = 6, Much more than average = 7

Label: Interviewer rating: how chaotic was the testing environment during the cognitive tasks?
Values: Not at all = 1, 2 = 2, 3 = 3, Moderately = 4, 5 = 5, 6 = 6, Much more than average = 7

Label: Interviewer rating: how often were you interrupted during the cognitive tasks? (including loudspeaker interruptions)
Values: Not at all = 1, 2 = 2, 3 = 3, Moderately = 4, 5 = 5, 6 = 6, Much more than average = 7

Label: Interviewer rating: how often was the participant distracted during the cognitive tasks?
Values: Not at all = 1, 2 = 2, 3 = 3, Moderately = 4, 5 = 5, 6 = 6, Much more than average = 7

Label: Interviewer rating: interview: average of the four interviewer rated items regarding the data collection setting
Have you ever felt like saying unkind things to a person?
Values: Yes = 1, No = 2

Label: Are you always careful about keeping your clothing neat and picking up after yourself?
Values: Yes = 1, No = 2

Label: Do you sometimes feel like staying home from school even if you are not sick?
Values: Yes = 1, No = 2

Label: Do you ever say anything that makes somebody else feel bad?
Values: Yes = 1, No = 2

Label: Are you always polite, even to people who are not very nice?
Values: Yes = 1, No = 2

Label: Sometimes, do you do things you've been told not to do?
Values: Yes = 1, No = 2

Label: Do you always listen to your parents or guardians?
Values: Yes = 1, No = 2

Label: Do you sometimes wish you could just play around instead of having to go to school?
Values: Yes = 1, No = 2

Label: Have you ever broken a rule?
Values: Yes = 1, No = 2

Label: Do you sometimes feel angry when you don't get your way?
Values: Yes = 1, No = 2

Label: Do you sometimes feel like making fun of other people?
Values: Yes = 1, No = 2

Label: Do you always do the right things?
Values: Yes = 1, No = 2

Label: Are there some times when you don't like to do what your parents tell you?
Values: Yes = 1, No = 2

Label: Do you sometimes get mad when people don't do what you want them to do?
Values: Yes = 1, No = 2

Label: Questionnaire: Child Social Desirability, sum of socially desirable answers, higher scores mean more socially desirable responding
Things were pretty calm and stable in my house.
Values: Never true = 1, Rarely true = 2, Sometimes true = 3, Often true = 4, Very often true = 5

Label: People moved in and out of my house a lot.
Values: Never true = 1, Rarely true = 2, Sometimes true = 3, Often true = 4, Very often true = 5

Label: I had a hard time knowing what my parent(s) or other people in my house were going to say or do from day-to-day.
Values: Never true = 1, Rarely true = 2, Sometimes true = 3, Often true = 4, Very often true = 5

Label: My parent(s) argued or fought a lot with each other or with other people.
Values: Never true = 1, Rarely true = 2, Sometimes true = 3, Often true = 4, Very often true = 5

Label: My parent(s) changed jobs a lot.
Values: Never true = 1, Rarely true = 2, Sometimes true = 3, Often true = 4, Very often true = 5

Label: My parental situation changed a lot (for example, divorce or separation of parents, parents starting new romantic relationships, parents leaving the home).
Values: Never true = 1, Rarely true = 2, Sometimes true = 3, Often true = 4, Very often true = 5

Label: Questionnaire: Childhood Unpredictability, average score, higher scores mean higher levels of percieved  childhood unpredictability
Interview: Timing of family disruption factor with 4 levels; 0 = no disruption, 1 = late disruption (6-13), 2 = early disruption (1-5), 3 = born into a disrupted family
Interview: Number of different parental figures that lived with the mother and/or father (or primary caregivers) in the same home
Interview: Number of residential moves involving changes in people
I grew up in a safe neighborhood.
Values: Never true = 1, Rarely true = 2, Sometimes true = 3, Often true = 4, Very often true = 5

Label: Crime was common in the neighborhood where I grew up.
Values: Never true = 1, Rarely true = 2, Sometimes true = 3, Often true = 4, Very often true = 5

Label: In the neighborhood where I grew up, people had plenty of money.
Values: Never true = 1, Rarely true = 2, Sometimes true = 3, Often true = 4, Very often true = 5

Label: In the neighborhood where I grew up, physical fights were common.
Values: Never true = 1, Rarely true = 2, Sometimes true = 3, Often true = 4, Very often true = 5

Label: In the neighborhood where I grew up, shootings or stabbings occurred.
Values: Never true = 1, Rarely true = 2, Sometimes true = 3, Often true = 4, Very often true = 5

Label: In the neighborhood where I grew up, most people felt unsafe walking alone after dark.
Values: Never true = 1, Rarely true = 2, Sometimes true = 3, Often true = 4, Very often true = 5

Label: Where I grew up, it was important to be able to defend yourself against physical harm.
Values: Never true = 1, Rarely true = 2, Sometimes true = 3, Often true = 4, Very often true = 5

Label: Questionnaire: Neighborhood Violence Exposure, average score, higher scores mean higher levels of exposure to neighborhood violence
Based on your experiences at school and in your neighborhood, how many times did you see or hear someone being beaten up in real life?
Values: 0 times = 1, 1 time = 2, 2 or 3 times = 3, 4 or 5 times = 4, 6 or 7 times = 5, 8 or 9 times = 6, 10 or 11 times = 7, 12 or more times = 8

Label: How many times were you in a physical fight at school or in your neighborhood?
Values: 0 times = 1, 1 time = 2, 2 or 3 times = 3, 4 or 5 times = 4, 6 or 7 times = 5, 8 or 9 times = 6, 10 or 11 times = 7, 12 or more times = 8

Label: Questionnaire: Exposure to Fighting, average of fighting1 and fighting2, highe scores mean higher levels of exposure and involvement in fighting
Your family had enough money to afford the kind of home you all needed.

Values: Never true = 1, Rarely true = 2, Sometimes true = 3, Often true = 4, Very often true = 5

Values: Never true = 1, Rarely true = 2, Sometimes true = 3, Often true = 4, Very often true = 5

Values: Never true = 1, Rarely true = 2, Sometimes true = 3, Often true = 4, Very often true = 5

School records: Fee waiver status
Values: No fee waiver = 0, fee waiver = 1

Label: School records: Homelessness status
Values: not homeless = 0, homeless = 1

Label: School records: Free lunch status
Values: no free lunch = 0, free lunch = 1

Label: School records: Reduced lunch status
Values: no reduced-price lunch = 0, reduced-price lunch = 1

Label: Interview: parental education level, mean of mother_education and father_education
occupational prestige: mean occupational prestige of mother and father's primary census score (higher scores mean more prestige)
Free lunch status (binary variables coded as 0 = no free lunch and 1 = free lunch), wjms_economic_disadvantage was used for wjms data, bgc_free_lunch for Boys and Girls data
Ecological Shifting: Total number of correct responses across all trials
Ecological Shifting: Mean reaction time for all 'repeat' trials (ms)
Ecological Shifting: Mean reaction time for all 'switch' trials (ms)
Ecological Shifting: The difference between the average reaction time for **valid** switch trials and average reaction time for **valid** repeat trials (ms)
Standard Shifting: Total number of correct responses across all trials
Standard Shifting: Mean reaction time for all 'repeat' trials (ms)
Standard Shifting: Mean reaction time for all 'switch' trials (ms)
Standard Shifting: The difference between the average reaction time for **valid** switch trials and average reaction time for **valid** repeat trials (ms)
Ecological Updating: Round 1, total number correct (correctly reported bills, buses, and faces)
Ecological Updating: Round 2, total number correct (correctly reported bills, buses, and faces)
Ecological Updating: Round 3, total number correct (correctly reported bills, buses, and faces)
Ecological Updating: Round 4, total number correct (correctly reported bills, buses, and faces)
Ecological Updating: Round 5, total number correct (correctly reported bills, buses, and faces)
Ecological Updating: Proportion correct for all rounds (total possible correct = 15)
Standard Updating: Round 1, total number correct (correctly reported squares, trianlges, and circles)
Standard Updating: Round 2, total number correct (correctly reported squares, trianlges, and circles)
Standard Updating: Round 3, total number correct (correctly reported squares, trianlges, and circles)
Standard Updating: Round 4, total number correct (correctly reported squares, trianlges, and circles)
Standard Updating: Round 5, total number correct (correctly reported squares, trianlges, and circles)
Standard Updating: Proportion correct for all rounds (total possible correct = 15)
